Detailed Description

One instance of the item-renderer properties may be assigned to a variable number of item renderers. The item-renderer properties defines how the item-renderer should render and animate its items. Usually GUI-components which use a renderer also offer methods for setting the item-properties (e. g. see AbstractItemGrid::SetRenderer).

As not all compilers support RTTI but this is very useful for item-renderer properties, they provide a RTTI-support by the method ItemRendererProperties::IsInstanceOf. This makes it necessary that each item-renderer properties class gets a unique ID. The IDs from 0 to 99 are reserved for APOXI.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumerator:
ID 

enum ItemRendererProperties::AnimType
 

Specifies the animation-type of the animation-properties. The IDs from 0 to 99 are reserved for APOXI.

See also:
AbstractItemRenderer::AnimProperties
Enumerator:
NoAnimation  The text will be clipped if it does not fit into the available area.
CycleAnimation  The text will be scrolled to one direction. Shortly before disappearing, the text scrolls in again from the opposite side.
BounceAnimation  The text will be scrolled to one direction. Shortly before disappearing, the scroll-direction switches and the text scrolls back to the original position.
BlinkingAnimation  The text blinks periodically. This type is not implemented yet in the DefaultItemRenderer.
IconAnimation  The icon will be animated in a custom manner. This type is not implemented yet in the DefaultItemRenderer. Note that if the icon itself is an image with more than one frame, an animation will be done anyway also with other animation types.
OnlyOnceAnimation  The text will be scrolled to one direction. In opposite to CycleAnimation the text will be scrolled only once.
CustomAnimation  Values above 99 may be used for custom animation types.
CycleVerticalAnimation 
CycleHorizontalAnimation 
HardVerticalAnimation 
HardHorizontalAnimation 
SoftVerticalAnimation 
SoftHorizontalAnimation 

enum ItemRendererProperties::DisplayType
 

Specifies categories for rendering the properties of an item. The IDs from 0 to 99 are reserved for APOXI.

Enumerator:
TextAndIconDisplayType  The text is aligned right beside the icon for languages written from left to right. For languages like Arabic the text is aligned left beside the icon.
TextDisplayType  The text is aligned above the icon.
IconDisplayType  Only the icon is displayed, the text will be ignored.
TextAboveIconDisplayType  The text is aligned above the icon.
TextBelowIconDisplayType  The text is aligned below the icon.
TextOverlapsIconDisplayType  The icon uses the whole area of the item and the text overlaps the icon.
CustomDisplayType  Values above 99 may be used for custom display types.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ItemRendererProperties::ItemRendererProperties (   ) 
 

ItemRendererProperties::ItemRendererProperties (  INT  display_type,
INT  anim_type,
UINT16  scroll_delay,
XYDIM  scroll_gap,
const TextFormat &  text_format,
BOOLEAN  full_screen_per_item = FALSE,
BOOLEAN  transparent = FALSE,
BOOLEAN  multi_line = FALSE,
BOOLEAN  centered_vertical = TRUE,
BOOLEAN  indicate_item_cont = FALSE,
const Color &  backgr_color = Color(Color::ClientBackground),
XYDIM  height = -1,
XYDIM  gap = 2,
INT  column_count = 1,
XYDIM  selection_height = -1,
UINT16  start_delay = 0,
const ImageObtainer &  backgr_image = ImageObtainer(),
const Color *  text_color = 0,
INT  renderer_hint = 0
) 
 

Parameters:
display_type Specifies the combination of the text and icon (see enum DisplayType).
anim_type Kind of animation for the text (see enum AnimType).
scroll_delay Delay in milliseconds until the next scroll step is done.
scroll_gap Gap in pixel for the textscrolling.
text_format Textformat of the text.
full_screen_per_item If set to TRUE, the item boundaries will be stretched to maximal possible size.
transparent If set to TRUE, no background for the item should be drawn per default.
multi_line If set to TRUE, the text is wrapped horizontally and displayed in several lines.
centered_vertical If set to TRUE, the text will be vertically centered. The horizontal text alignment can be defined by setting the text format (see ItemRendererProperties::SetTextFormat).
indicate_item_cont If set to TRUE, an item-container is indicated by an arrow on the right side.
backgr_color Specifies the background-color of the item. Is only used, if transparent is FALSE.
height Height of the item in pixels. If -1 is used, it is in the hand of the control which uses an item renderer to specify the height. Usually -1 means that the height of the font is chosen.
gap Gap in pixels for the item-border.
column_count Preferred number of columns, if several items are rendered inside a control. If a control may only contain one item, this parameter is ignored.
selection_height Height of the selected item in pixels.
start_delay Delay in milliseconds until the scrolling of the text is started.
backgr_image Background image for the item. Note that the transparent property must be set to TRUE to have a visible background image.
text_color Color of the item text. If text_color is 0, the color Color::ClientForeground defined by the theme is used. The passed color object is copied internally and hence can be deleted after invoking the method.
renderer_hint Sets the hint for the renderer, which can be used in GuiEngineConfig::ObtainItemRenderer to specify which kind of custom renderer should be created. A value of 0 means that the DefaultItemRenderer should be used. The definition of the meaning for values greater than 0 are customer specific.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN ItemRendererProperties::FullScreenPerItem (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE; if the height of the item should be maximized to fill the whole screen. In this case the property height (see ItemRendererProperties::GetHeight and ItemRendererProperties::SetHeight) will be ignored.

See also:
ItemRenderer::AnimType

const Color& ItemRendererProperties::GetBackgroundColor (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the background color of the item. The background color will be ignored if the transparent property (see ItemRendererProperties::SetTransparent and ItemRendererProperties::IsTransparent) is set.

const ImageObtainer& ItemRendererProperties::GetBackgroundImage (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the background image of the item.

INT ItemRendererProperties::GetColumnCount (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the preferred number of columns, if several items are rendered inside a control. If a control may only contain one item, this parameter is ignored.

See also:

XYDIM ItemRendererProperties::GetGap (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the gap between the icon, text and border of the item.

XYDIM ItemRendererProperties::GetHeight (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the preferred height of the item. If -1 is used, it is in the hand of the control which uses an item renderer to specify the height. Usually -1 means that the height of the font is chosen.

INT ItemRendererProperties::GetRendererHint (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the renderer hint. Per default 0 is returned which means that the DefaultItemRenderer should be used. See ItemRendererProperties::SetRendererHint for more details.

UINT16 ItemRendererProperties::GetScrollDelay (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the scroll delay in milliseconds.

XYDIM ItemRendererProperties::GetScrollGap (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the scroll gap in pixels.

XYDIM ItemRendererProperties::GetSelectionHeight (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the preferred height of an item in the selected state. If -1 is used, the default height (see ItemRendererProperties::GetHeight) is chosen.

UINT16 ItemRendererProperties::GetStartDelay (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the delay in milliseconds until the scrolling of the text is started. Per default 0 is returned.

const Color & ItemRendererProperties::GetTextColor (   )  const
 

Returns the color of the item text. Per default the color of Client::Foreground is used.

const TextFormat& ItemRendererProperties::GetTextFormat (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the textformat of the text. see ItemRendererProperties::SetTextFormat for more details.

BOOLEAN ItemRendererProperties::IndicateItemContainer (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if an item container will be indicated by a small arrow.

BOOLEAN ItemRendererProperties::IsInstanceOf (  INT  id  )  const [virtual]
 

Returns TRUE, if the item is an instance of the item-class with the ID id. Must be implemented by each derived class the following way: 

BOOLEAN MyItemRendererProperties::IsInstanceOf(INT id) const
{
    BOOLEAN is_instance = (ID == id);
    if (!is_instance)
        is_instance = Base::IsInstanceOf(id);
    return is_instance;
}

Example: if it should be checked, whether an item is an instance of the class Action the following code might be used: 

if (properties->IsInstanceOf(MyItemRendererProperties::ID)) {
    MyItemRendererProperties* properties = (MyItemRendererProperties*)properties;
    ...
}

BOOLEAN ItemRendererProperties::IsMultiLine (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the text of the item will be wrapped into several lines to fit into the available width.

BOOLEAN ItemRendererProperties::IsTransparent (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if no background for the item will be drawn.

BOOLEAN ItemRendererProperties::IsVerticalCentered (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the text should be centered vertically inside the available height.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetAnimType (  INT  anim_type  )  [inline]
 

See also:
ItemRenderer::AnimType

void ItemRendererProperties::SetBackgroundColor (  const Color &  backgr_color  ) 
 

Sets the background color of the item. The background color will be ignored if the transparent property (see ItemRendererProperties::SetTransparent and ItemRendererProperties::IsTransparent) is set.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetBackgroundImage (  const ImageObtainer &  backgr_image  )  [inline]
 

Sets the background image for the item. Note that the transparent property must be set to TRUE to have a visible background image.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetColumnCount (  INT  column_count  )  [inline]
 

Sets the preferred number of columns, if several items are rendered inside a control. If a control may only contain one item, this parameter is ignored.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetDisplayType (  INT  display_type  )  [inline]
 

See also:
ItemRenderer::DisplayType

void ItemRendererProperties::SetFullScreenPerItem (  BOOLEAN  full_screen_per_item  )  [inline]
 

If set to TRUE, the height of the item should be maximized to fill the whole screen. In this case the property height (see ItemRendererProperties::GetHeight and ItemRendererProperties::SetHeight) will be ignored.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetGap (  XYDIM  gap  )  [inline]
 

Sets the gap between the icon, text and border of the item.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetHeight (  XYDIM  height  )  [inline]
 

Sets the preferred height of the item. If -1 is used, it is in the hand of the control which uses an item renderer to specify the height. Usually -1 means that the height of the font is chosen.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetIndicateItemContainer (  BOOLEAN  flag  )  [inline]
 

If set to TRUE, an item container will be indicated by a small arrow.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetMultiLine (  BOOLEAN  multi_line  )  [inline]
 

If set to TRUE, the text of the item will be wrapped into several lines to fit into the available width.

BOOLEAN ItemRendererProperties::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetRendererHint (  INT  renderer_hint  )  [inline]
 

Sets the hint for the renderer, which can be used in GuiEngineConfig::ObtainItemRenderer to specify which kind of custom renderer should be created. A value of 0 means that the DefaultItemRenderer should be used. The definition of the meaning for values greater than 0 are customer specific.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetScrollDelay (  UINT16  scroll_delay  ) 
 

Sets the delay for scrolling in milliseconds. A scroll delays below 50 milliseconds will be converted to 50 milliseconds.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetScrollGap (  XYDIM  scroll_gap  ) 
 

Sets the scroll gap in pixels. A scroll gap < 1 will be converted to 1.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetSelectionHeight (  XYDIM  selection_height  )  [inline]
 

Sets the preferred height of an item in the selected state. If -1 is used, the default height (see ItemRendererProperties::GetHeight) is chosen.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetStartDelay (  UINT16  start_delay  )  [inline]
 

Sets the delay in milliseconds until the scrolling of the text is started. 0 is the default value.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetTextColor (  const Color *  text_color  ) 
 

Sets the color of the item text. If text_color is 0, the color Color::ClientForeground defined by the theme is used. The passed color object is copied internally and hence can be deleted after invoking the method.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetTextFormat (  const TextFormat &  text_format  )  [inline]
 

Sets the textformat for the text. Note that if the display type is set to 'IconDisplayType' no text will be shown at all.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetTransparent (  BOOLEAN  transparent  )  [inline]
 

If set to TRUE, no background for the item will be drawn.

void ItemRendererProperties::SetVerticalCentered (  BOOLEAN  vertical_centered  )  [inline]
 

If set to TRUE, the text should be centered vertically inside the available height.
